arts.ttl: Welbeck scores twice to give Brighton late win against Newcastle
arts.sum: Danny Welbeck secures Brighton a win 2-1 against Newcastle after opening the scoring in the first half and cancelling out a late equaliser from Nick Woltemade in the second.

arts.ttl: Newcastle United losing to the likes of Brighton…
arts.sum: Newcastle United lost 2-1 to Brighton on Saturday afternoon, as you no doubt know. I couldn’t get down to the match today but watched the game online. United started well... You can click here to read the full article. Source

arts.ttl: Fabian Hurzeler holds a high opinion of ‘physical’ and ‘high tempo’ Newcastle
arts.sum: “They are very physical team, very man-oriented, good intensity. Newcastle have kept clean sheets in five of their seven Premier League games, failing to concede a single goal across three away fixtures.

arts.ttl: Brighton 2-1 Newcastle United: Welbeck Wraps Up A Significant Success for the Seagulls
arts.sum: The Seagulls seized on the hesitation of their visitors, who have struggled on the road, and they went ahead with a goal from Danny Welbeck, deservedly ending the first half with a goal advantage. Baleba and Rutter broke forward, releasing Kadioglu to cross the ball along the face of the six yard box without a blue and white shirt present to connect.

arts.ttl: Welbeck winner: Brighton striker outshines Woltemade as Toon suffer another loss
arts.sum: Brighton & Hove Albion get back to winning ways in the Premier League on Saturday, beating Newcastle United 2-1 at the Amex Stadium.

arts.ttl: Brighton’s Danny Welbeck sees off Newcastle despite Woltemade magic
arts.athr: John Brewin at the Amex Stadium
arts.sum: As Brighton’s mix of young hearts ran free, a canny campaigner condemned Newcastle to defeat in a stadium they are yet to win at in the Premier League. Danny Welbeck’s two goals were moments of rare composure in a squall of a contest. Welbeck’s also denied the Toon Army’s latest folk hero. From Lewis Miley’s pass, Nick Woltemade’s backheel flick, a speciality, had levelled the scoring. Welbeck’s first was a moment of equal delicacy, his second saw him thrash a loose ball home. Brighton snatched a third win of the Premier League season, all against opponents playing in the Champions League, Newcastle following Chelsea and Manchester City. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Danny Welbeck bags brace as Brighton win battle with Newcastle
arts.sum: Nick Woltemade produced a sublime moment of skill to equalise with a devilish back-heel, 14 minutes from time.

arts.ttl: Woltemade stunner in vain as Welbeck fires Brighton past Newcastle
